Dating: 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before); 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD ?; LATE PERIOD (not after)
Name: Fragment of a coffin
Description: This wooden fragment, which was found during the excavations by W. F. Petrie at Tarkhan, was part of a lid of a coffin. This one is actually in several pieces and is in a very bad state. One of the parts bears a fragmentary hieroglyphic text written in a single verticle column. The face represented here is not complete; the upper part (the hair) has disappeared. The features are finely sculpted; the eyelids  and the eyebrows are emphasized by black lines.
